intro: Jacquemontia selloi var. guaranitica, commonly known as the Guaraní morning glory, is a climbing vine native to South America. It features heart-shaped, velvety leaves and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of purple and pink. The plant is characterized by its rapid growth and ability to thrive in humid, tropical environments. It is often found in forest understories and along streambanks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking vibrant, flowering climbers.
